result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew J Mussomeli was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

[MK] case called at 3:47pm. 
Defendant Andrew J Mussomeli in court, in custody, with Attorney Adam Galaviz.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The parties indicate that they do not have any factual corrections to make to the Revocation Order and Warrant information. 
Sentencing arguments given by counsel. 

On Count #1, the Court sentences Mr. Mussomeli to:
---serve 85 days in Jefferson County Jail to commence forthwith (time served) 
--87 days credit for time already served given
--pay costs and fees that remain due; once the Bookkeeper determines the correct amount due, the Bookkeeper is to give notice of this amount to counsel and Mr. Mussomeli.  Mr. Mussomeli is to make payments of $200 per month installments commencing on 8/22/16 and on the 22nd day of each month thereafter until paid in full; non-payment shall result in a 16 day jail term with Huber privileges, consecutive
recess 4:05pm

records.addlTxt: With elements and criminal case settlement agreement forms attached.

Case called at 11:24am [mo]
Defendant Andrew J Mussomeli in court with Attorney Adam Galaviz.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
  
DA Happ orally motions for Count #1 to be amended to misdemeanor possession of THC contrary to 961.41(3g)(e)
The Court grants motion to amend Count #1

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of "No Contest" entered on Amended Count #1; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #2.
Sentencing arguments given by Counsel 

On Count #1, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 1 year, with conditions:

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to attempt obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--maintain absolute sobriety
--no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores
--monthly testing for illegal drug use
--to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge
--to pay drug testing fees in the amount of $25


Days credit for time already served:  0  days
recess:11:42am
